summary: This bill, the Radiation Exposure Compensation Reauthorization Act, extends the period for filing claims under the Radiation Exposure Compensation Act. It expands compensation for those affected by Manhattan Project waste and uranium mining, including workers and individuals living near testing sites. The bill outlines compensation amounts, defines affected areas and specified diseases, expands the use of affidavits for claims, and establishes a grant program for studying the health impacts of uranium mining. Additionally, it makes changes to the Energy Employees Occupational Illness Compensation Program.
